title: With little public notice, Toomey announces a teleconference town meeting
text:
With little public notice, Toomey announces a teleconference town meeting Updated: February 16, 2017 — 2:08 PM EST 528 Share (AP Photo) U.S. Sen. Pat Toomey, R-Pa., provided more reason for concern this week with his response to the forced resignation of national security adviser Michael Flynn. He seemed more concerned that the media found out Flynn lied about contacts with Russian officials than that the contacts occurred. 
With little notice, Sen. Pat Toomey, R-Pa., announced he would hold a telephone town meeting at 2:05 p.m. today. 
Toomey has come under fire for not holding in person, public constituent meetings. 
Around 12:30 p.m., he posted this on Facebook : 
Please join me for my 48th telephone town hall today/Thursday at 2:05. Listen on your cell phone or computer and ask me a question online. Click here for the audio link. http://vekeo.buzz/Toomey 
A press release or a tweet from Toomey announcing the teleconference could not be found.
